title: The Bride of Dionysus
text:
The Bride of Dionysus is an <a href="opera">opera</a> by <a href="Donald%20Tovey">Donald Tovey</a>, to a <a href="libretto">libretto</a> by <a href="R.%20C.%20Trevelyan">R. C. Trevelyan</a>. It was written between 1907 and 1918, and premiered at the <a href="Empire%20Theatre%20%28Edinburgh%29">Empire Theatre</a>, Edinburgh, on 23 April 1929.
"The Bride of Dionysus".
"The Bride" is Tovey's only opera. It is based on the legends of <a href="Theseus">Theseus</a>, <a href="Ariadne">Ariadne</a>, and the <a href="Minotaur">Minotaur</a>. After its premiere, it received a few further performances in Edinburgh in 1929 and 1932. Although <a href="Fritz%20Busch">Fritz Busch</a> enquired about the opera for performance at <a href="Glyndebourne%20Festival%20Opera">Glyndebourne Festival Opera</a>, nothing came of this. Extracts from the opera were released on CD in 2010. The manuscript of the opera is at the Reid Music Library at <a href="Edinburgh%20University">Edinburgh University</a>.
